author: AFP
title: Japan sees hottest July since records began - Times of India
text: TOKYO: Japan sweltered through its hottest July since records began 126 years ago, the weather agency said, as extreme heatwaves fuelled by climate change engulfed many parts of the globe.Temperatures in the country were 2.16 degrees Celsius higher than average, breaking last year's record for July of 1.91 degrees Celsius above average.\"It was the highest since statistics began in 1898,\" the Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) said Thursday, noting that the figures were \"considerably higher\" nationwide.Of 153 observation posts across Japan, 62 broke their average temperature record in July.Contributing factors included a high-pressure system over the Pacific and \"warm air from the south\" that shrouded northern parts of the archipelago, the JMA said.Since April, heatstroke has killed 59 people in Japan, according to the disaster management agency.Parasols and chunky necklaces that can be stored in the freezer have been a common sight around Tokyo, where street performer Jiro Kan, 56, told AFP he was feeling the heat.\"After spending two hours standing here, I get so sweaty I can literally squeeze it all out from my shirt. I'm drenched,\" said Kan, dressed in an all-yellow suit.\"People who are used to a more dry type of heat like in the United States find the heat and humidity in Japan more difficult to handle,\" he said in tourist hotspot Asakusa.Last month, Shizuoka west of Tokyo became the first Japanese region to see the mercury reach 40 degrees Celsius (104 Fahrenheit) this year -- far surpassing the 35-degree threshold deemed \"extremely hot\" by authorities.Heatwaves are becoming increasingly common across the globe, with the European Union's climate monitor saying in July that the Earth experienced its warmest day in recorded history.

author: Mirage News
title: 2D Metals: Chinese Scientists Break Atomic Barriers | Mirage News
text:
Since the groundbreaking discovery of graphene in 2004, the dizzying pace of progress in two-dimensional (2D) materials has ushered in a new era of fundamental research and technological innovation. Although nearly 2,000 2D materials have been theoretically predicted and hundreds have been created in laboratory settings, most of these 2D materials are limited to van der Waals (vdW) layered crystals.
Scientists have long been keen to develop atomically thin 2D metals, thereby expanding the 2D material family beyond vdW layered structures. These ultrathin 2D metals would also enable the exploration of novel physics and new device architectures. Over the past few years, many attempts have been made to realize 2D metals, but these attempts have failed to achieve large-size and pristine 2D metals at the atomically thin limit.
Now, however, researchers from the Institute of Physics (IOP) of the Chinese Academy of Sciences have developed a convenient, universal, atomic-level manufacturing technique-called vdW squeezing-for the production of 2D metals at the angstrom thickness limit. This study was recently published in Nature.
The manufacturing technique involves melting and squeezing pure metals between two rigid vdW anvils under high pressure. With this method, the researchers produced diverse atomically thin 2D metals, including Bi (~6.3 Å), Sn (~5.8 Å), Pb (~7.5 Å), In (~8.4 Å) and Ga (~9.2 Å).
The vdW anvils consist of two single-crystalline MoS2 monolayers epitaxially grown on sapphire. The anvils are essential for producing 2D metals for two reasons. First, the atomically flat, dangling-bond-free surface of the monolayer MoS2/sapphire ensures uniform 2D metal thickness over a large scale. Second, the high Young's modulus of both sapphire and monolayer MoS2 (> 300 GPa) allows them to withstand extreme pressures, enabling 2D metals formed between the two anvils to approach their angstrom thickness limit.
The 2D metals synthesized via this process were stabilized through complete encapsulation between two MoS2 monolayers, making them environmentally stable and ensuring non-bonded interfaces. This structure facilitated device fabrication by allowing access to their intrinsic transport properties, which were previously unavailable. Electrical and spectroscopic measurements of monolayer Bi revealed excellent physical properties, including significantly enhanced electrical conductivity, a strong field effect with p-type behavior, large nonlinear Hall conductivity, and new phonon modes.
This vdW squeezing, atomic-level manufacturing method not only offers a versatile approach to realizing various 2D metals but can also control the thickness of 2D metals with atomic precision (i.e., monolayer, bilayer, or trilayer) by controlling the squeezing pressure. This method offers extraordinary opportunities for revealing the exotic layer-dependent properties of 2D metals-something that was not possible before.
Prof. ZHANG Guangyu from IOP, corresponding author of the study, said that the vdW squeezing technique offers an effective atomic-level method for manufacturing 2D metal alloys, as well as amorphous and other 2D non-vdW compounds. He also noted that this method outlines a "bright vision" for a broad range of emerging quantum, electronic, and photonic devices. He emphasized that there is "plenty of room" for this new research field to grow in the future.

author: RT en Español
title: Senador estadounidense llama a bombardear Irán - RT
text:
Senador estadounidense llama a bombardear Irán Publicado: 28 dic 2023 19:31 GMT "Bórrenlo del mapa", declaró Lindsey Graham en referencia al cuartel general de la Guardia Revolucionaria de Irán.
El senador Lindsey Graham. Bill Clark / CQ-Roll Call, Inc / Gettyimages.ru El senador republicano Lindsey Graham ha instado a EE.UU. que ataque a Irán para proteger a sus soldados en Oriente Medio, ya que, en su opinión, Teherán está respaldando a los hutíes, que lanzan ataques regulares contra las fuerzas estadounidenses, según declaró este miércoles a Fox News .
Afirmó que la "debilidad" es lo que ha provocado una escalada significativa en la región. Graham criticó a la Administración del presidente Joe Biden por "fallar" a los soldados estadounidenses en Oriente Medio tras la escalada del conflicto entre Israel y Hamás.
EE.UU. derriba 12 drones y varios misiles lanzados por los hutíes en el mar Rojo " Deberíamos poder derrotar a los hutíes. El secretario [de Defensa de EE.UU., Lloyd] Austin, y la Administración Biden están fallando a nuestras tropas sobre el terreno ", dijo Graham.
Asimismo, señaló que, aunque admira a Austin, calificándolo de "gran patriota", no cree que esté haciendo un buen trabajo protegiendo a los soldados estadounidenses.
"Los hutíes están totalmente respaldados por Irán. Llevo seis meses diciéndolo: golpeen a Irán. Tienen campos petrolíferos al aire libre. Tienen el cuartel general de la Guardia Revolucionaria. Pueden verlo desde el espacio, bórrenlo del mapa ", instó Graham.
Si EE.UU. realmente quiere proteger a los soldados estadounidenses es necesario "hacérselo real para el ayatolá", subrayó Graham en referencia al líder supremo de Irán, el ayatolá Alí Hoseiní Jameneí.
Previamente, tres militares estadounidenses resultaron heridos en Irak el día de Navidad, cuando integrantes del grupo paramilitar chiita iraquí Kataeb Hezbolá atacaron la base aérea de Erbil. Uno de los heridos se encontraba en estado crítico. En respuesta, las fuerzas estadounidenses llevaron a cabo ataques aéreos contra tres instalaciones utilizadas por Kataeb Hezbolá y grupos afiliados en Irak.

author: JERUSALEM POST STAFF
title: Police arrest two German nationals planning synagogue knife attack - The Jerusalem Post
text:
German police arrested two men who were accused of allegedly planning a knife attack at a synagogue in the southwestern city of Heidelberg, the German news agency dpa reported on Friday.
The suspects, an 18-year-old and 24-year-old, allegedly discussed “the killing of one or more visitors in the attack on the synagogue followed by death as martyrs, whereby the two persons wanted to be shot to death by police,” authorities said in a statement.
The 18-year-old is being held on conspiracy to commit murder , public prosecutors and criminal investigators in the south-western German state of Baden-Wurttemberg announced on Friday. The suspect is originally from the town of Weinheim, and also has Turkish citizenship, according to ABC News, citing German authorities. One man had been shot and captured in early May
The 24-year-old had been shot and captured earlier in May by police after a raid on the man's apartment became violent. On May 3, police raided his home in the town of Bad Friedrichshall on suspicion of preparing a serious act of violence endangering the state, according to German news agency dpa.
The 24-year-old suspect had taken several kitchen knives and fled outside through a window while officers were in his apartment. When police caught him, he threw a life toward a policeman and charged at him. The officer then shot him. Soccer Football - Bundesliga 2 - Hertha BSC v Hansa Rostock - Olympiastadion, Berlin, Germany - April 12, 2024 Police officers are pictured at the Olympiastadion train station after the match. (credit: REUTERS/ANNEGRET HILSE)
The 24-year-old man was treated for his wounds and remains in police custody on allegations of attempted manslaughter and a serious case of assault on a police officer.
Following the raid of the 24-year-old's home, police uncovered a link to the 18-year-old from Weinheim. Police say that the 24-year-old had discussed a possible knife attack on visitors to a synagogue in Heidelberg in April 24 with the 18-year-old.
The 18-year-old's apartment was search and he was arrested and remains in custody. There is no additional threat to visitors to the synagogue at this time.
German leaders have warned of a surge in antisemitism amid the ongoing war between Israel and Hamas.

title: "Necesito hablar de eso y lo haré". A la segunda temporada de La Casa del Dragón parece haberle salido un gran detractor, nada menos que George R. R. Martin
text: Ya sea por los dos años que tuvimos que esperar desde la primera temporada, por la falta de acción, o por algunas decisiones controvertidas, se puede decir que [el regreso de La Casa del Dragón](https://www.3djuegos.com/tv-series/noticias/temporada-2-casa-dragon-recupera-toda-gloria-epica-juego-tronos-critica-primeros-episodios) no ha dejado tan emocionado al público como lo hizo estreno en 2022 a través de HBO y Max (entonces HBO Max). Lo que no podíamos imaginar es que a George R. R. Martin no le esté gustando del todo. Al padre de la criatura nunca le ha temblado el pulso a la hora de mostrar su decepción con el devenir de las adaptaciones de sus libros, y según parece la segunda temporada de La Casa del Dragón no será la excepción. Eso sí, antes de hablar prefiere tomarse un descanso y, suponemos, asentar su opinión. "Necesito escribir sobre todo lo que salió mal con La Casa del Dragón. Necesito hacerlo y lo haré, pero no hoy. Hoy es el Zozobra's Day y hay que dejar la tristeza atrás". Podemos esperar en unos días una larga publicación del escritor al respecto, pero ya sabemos que el estadounidense pidió en el pasado cuatro temporadas de 10 capítulos, y esta última solo ha tenido ocho episodios, lo que ha podido afectar a que la historia no tuviera ese final por todo lo alto que esperaban algunos fans. Fuego y Sangre (Canción de hielo y fuego): 300 años antes de Juego de Tronos. Sí lo tiene de las esperas entre temporadas que pueden agotar al público, y por la que algunos fans ya hacen campaña por [el rodaje de múltiples temporadas](https://www.3djuegos.com/tv-series/noticias/esperar-dos-anos-no-tiene-sentido-fans-juego-tronos-se-vuelven-muy-impacientes-larga-espera-temporadas-casa-dragon).
